intro: Calystegia silvatica subsp. pulchra, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a herbaceous vine characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically pale blue to violet, with five petals and a prominent central spur. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and blooms from late spring to early summer. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
